title: Scotland, its faith and its features; or, a Visit to Blair Athol
author: Trench, Francis.
snippet: The inn, where I now write, is not many milesfrom some property of a valued friend ofmine, under whose roof, near Newcastle, wehope to be to-morrow ; and not far from hisplace in this neighbourhood occurred the sadcalamity, on which was founded the touchingballad, well known in this country, called, "TheSnow Shroud ; or, the Lost Bairn of Biddlestone Edge," by the Rev. R. C. Cox, Vicar ofNewcastle.
